DIV1.P: FROM THE UNIQUE GLASGOW MS, PARALLEL WITH ITS ORIGINAL Le Roman de la Rose.
EDITED BY MAX KALUZA, PH. D.
PUBLISHT FOR THE CHAUCER SOCIETY BY KEGAN PAUL, TRENCH, TRÜBNER & CO., PATERNOSTER HOUSE, CHARING CROSS ROAD, W. C.
THE ENGLISH FRAGMENTS FROM THE UNIQUE MS. V. 3. 7 IN THE HUNTERIAN MUSEUM, GLASGOW, WITH THEIR FRENCH ORIGINAL MAINLY FROM M. MICHEL'S EDITION, 1864, COLLATED WITH OTHER MSS.
EDITED BY MAX KALUZA, PH. D., KÖNIGSBERG.

HEADNOTE.P: The English text closely follows the unique MS. V. 3. 7, Hunterian Museum, Glasgow. Eleven leaves (containing ll. 1-44, 333-380, 1387-1482, 2395-2442, 3595-3690, 7383-7574) are now lost in the MS.; the deficiency is supplied from Thynne's edition (1532). In the foot-notes I give corrections from Morris's (= M.), Bell's (= B.), and Urry's (= U.) editions, with some emendations of my own.
